intro: Hypodematium, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species that are native to various regions of Europe and Asia. These plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are yellow and arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. Hypodematium species are often found in meadows and grasslands, and they are known for their ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
